definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: And when it was made plain who Kino was, the doctor grew stern and judicious at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 弄清楚誰是吉納後，醫生變得嚴肅認真而又明智起來。

sentences.english: She had a cultivated mind, and was, generally speaking, rational and consistent;
sentences.chinese: 她心性嫺雅，一般說來也很明智，堅定。

sentences.english: Between these four ways, a less sagacious man would have remained undecided.
sentences.chinese: 在這四條路中，不如他明智的人一定會猶豫不決。

sentences.english: At this time, avoid to defeat psychological, not tired is wise.
sentences.chinese: 此時，切忌不甘失敗的心理，不戀戰是明智之舉。

sentences.english: A form of contraception is therefore advisable, but a simple condom will be ineffective.
sentences.chinese: 因此避孕是明智的，但是簡單的避孕套會無效。

sentences.english: I dissent altogether from such an unwise idea.
sentences.chinese: 我對這種不明智的意見全然持異議。

sentences.english: Your wise decision can alter the destiny of abandoned animals.
sentences.chinese: 你一個明智的決定足以改變棄養動物的命運。

sentences.english: This is something the wise businessperson knows .
sentences.chinese: 這是明智的商人知道了。

sentences.english: Is furthermore small and soft to calculate, queen mother this undertaking really has already lost advisability.
sentences.chinese: 再者細細推算，太后此舉委實有失明智。

sentences.english: Aircraft noise is unwitting of passengers.
sentences.chinese: 飛機噪音是旅客不明智所至。

sentences.english: They co ider it wise not to criticize him.
sentences.chinese: 他們認爲不批評他是明智的。

sentences.english: V. I will choose my friends wisely.
But the wise took oil in their vessels with the lamps.
sentences.chinese: 而明智的拿了燈，並且在壼裏帶了油。

sentences.english: Every stage is necessary so we can become wiser.
sentences.chinese: 每一步都是必要的，我們因而變得更明智。

sentences.english: It is absurd to force children to take extra studies after sch ol.
sentences.chinese: 因此，放學後強迫孩子額外學習是不明智的。

sentences.english: Still, I think it unwise for either of us to insist on hisownprice.
sentences.chinese: 不過，我認爲彼此都堅持自己的價格是不明智的。

definition: willingness/would rather (agree to X than Y)
to have no alternative (idiom); compelled by circumstances/forced into sth
